data.Name: Gil Cote
data.staff_bio: Gil Cote brings many years of community rehabilitation provider experience to the ICI Team, serving as a great resource in shaping policy and training related to the needs of community rehabilitation providers. He has twenty-six years of experience working for individuals with disabilities to achieve community inclusion. His experience includes helping to design and implement some of the first concepts focused on inclusion of people with significant disabilities in community employment in the state of Massachusetts. Gil has held many senior level management and leadership positions with several organizations that meet the needs of people with disabilities. Just prior to joining ICI, Gil spent 14 years with Community Enterprises, most recently as Regional Director of Operations for the Eastern Division. Gil has worked to improve services for people with disabilities as a long-term board member of the Massachusetts chapter of APSE and is presently its President. Gil collaborated with a special team from Massachusetts to design outreach materials for the President's Committee on Disabilities. Gil has also served as President and Chairman of several community organizations, which has allowed him the opportunity to facilitate many state and federal agencies to work in a collaborative fashion to better meet the needs of people with disabilities. Gil has a Masters of Management from Cambridge College with a concentration in negotiation and conflict resolution.
data.staff_ed: M.M., Concentration in Negotiation and Conflict Resolution, Cambridge College
